noun.description: A feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause.
examples: an air of melancholy surrounded him
he had an ability to convey a sense of deep melancholy and yearning through much of his work
at the center of his music lies a profound melancholy and nostalgia

adjective.description: Having a feeling of melancholy; sad and pensive.
examples: the dog has a melancholy expression

origin: Middle English: from Old French melancolie, via late Latin from Greek melankholia, from melas, melan- black + kholē bile, an excess of which was formerly believed to cause depression.
